trans-unit.source: , is a dictionary of ways the password could be improved. The keys of the dict are general “categories” of ways to improve the password (e.g. “length”) that are fixed strings, and the values are internationalizable strings that are human-friendly descriptions and possibly tailored to the specific password.
trans-unit.target: , is a dictionary of ways the password could be improved. The keys of the dict are general “categories” of ways to improve the password (e.g. “length”) that are fixed strings, and the values are internationalizable strings that are human-friendly descriptions and possibly tailored to the specific password.

trans-unit.source: A configurable, extensible password strength measuring library.
A password’s strength is determined by doing a weighted, skewed, curved average of a set of “factors”. The

trans-unit.source: Specifies the asset-spec for the factory that can generate a Factor of this type.
trans-unit.target: Указание актива-spec для завода,который может сгенерировать Коэффициент этого типа.

trans-unit.source: Specifies the maximum score for which improvement messages should be returned. If not specified, all possible improvements will be returned, even if the relevant factor returned a perfect score (1.0 or greater).
trans-unit.target: Указывает максимальный балл,на который должны быть возвращены сообщения об улучшениях.Если не указано,все возможные улучшения будут возвращены,даже если соответствующий фактор вернул отличную оценку (1.0 или выше).

trans-unit.source: Specifies the relative weight of this factor (default: 1).
trans-unit.target: Указывает относительный вес этого коэффициента (по умолчанию:1).

trans-unit.source: The first element (float) of the return tuple must be greater or equal to zero. Although it should generally not be greater than 1.0, a factor may return a greater value: this is used to artificially boost the strength of the total outcome relative to the other factors if applicable. Note, however, that the Meter class will always clip the final outcome to the inclusive range [0, 1].
trans-unit.target: The first element (float) of the return tuple must be greater or equal to zero. Although it should generally not be greater than 1.0, a factor may return a greater value: this is used to artificially boost the strength of the total outcome relative to the other factors if applicable. Note, however, that the Meter class will always clip the final outcome to the inclusive range [0, 1].

method, which returns a tuple of (float, dict). The float is the strength of the password in the range 0 to 1 (inclusive), where 0 is extremely weak and 1 is extremely strong. The second parameter, which may be

trans-unit.source: setting, the factor will be auto-added to the list of factors. This is the preferred mechanism to add a custom factor to the default list.

trans-unit.source: setting, which defaults to 10 – the higher, the more a low score will pull the average score down. For example, with the default pessimism of 10, the two scores 0.75 and 0.25 will be averaged to 0.4 (instead of the true average of 0.5).
